Interface AdRuleServiceInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdRuleServiceSoapBindingStub

    public interface AdRuleServiceInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote

    • Method Detail

      • createAdRule

        AdRule createAdRule(AdRule adRule)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                           ApiException
        Creates a new AdRule. The following fields are required:
        • AdRule.id
        • AdRule.name
        • AdRule.priority
        • AdRule.startDateTime
        • AdRule.endDateTime
        • AdRule.preroll
        • AdRule.midroll
        • AdRule.postroll
        Parameters:
        adRule - the ad rule to create
        Returns:
        the ad rule with its ID filled in
        Throws:
        ApiException - if there the ad rule is invalid or there is another error
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • createAdRules

        AdRule[] createAdRules(AdRule[] adRules)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              ApiException
        Creates new AdRule objects.
        Parameters:
        adRules - the ad rules to create
        Returns:
        the created ad rules with their IDs filled in
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        ApiException

      • getAdRule

        AdRule getAdRule(java.lang.Integer adRuleId)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        ApiException
        Returns the AdRule uniquely identified by the given ID.
        Parameters:
        adRuleId - the ID of the ad rule, which must already exist
        Returns:
        the AdRule uniquely identified by the given ID
        Throws:
        ApiException - if there is an error retrieving the ad rule or the ID is invalid
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAdRulesByStatement

        AdRulePage getAdRulesByStatement(Statement statement)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                        ApiException
        Gets an AdRulePage of AdRule objects that satisfy the given Statement.query. The following fields are supported for filtering:
        PQL Property Object Property
        id AdRule.id
        name AdRule.name
        priority AdRule.priority
        status AdRule.status
        Parameters:
        filterStatement - a Publisher Query Language statement used to filter a set of ad rules
        Returns:
        the ad rules that match the given filter
        Throws:
        ApiException - if the ID of the active network does not exist or there is a backend error
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • performAdRuleAction

        UpdateResult performAdRuleAction(AdRuleAction adRuleAction,
                               Statement filterStatement)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                        ApiException
        Performs actions on AdRule objects that match the given Statement.query.
        Parameters:
        adRuleAction - the action to perform
        filterStatement - a Publisher Query Language statement used to filter a set of ad rules
        Returns:
        the result of the action performed
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        ApiException

      • updateAdRule

        AdRule updateAdRule(AdRule adRule)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                           ApiException
        Updates a previously-created AdRule.
        Parameters:
        adRule - the ad rule that should be updated
        Returns:
        the updated ad rule
        Throws:
        ApiException - if there is an error updating the ad rule
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • updateAdRules

        AdRule[] updateAdRules(AdRule[] adRules)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              ApiException
        Updates the specified AdRule objects.
        Parameters:
        adRules - the ad rules to update
        Returns:
        the updated ad rules
        Throws:
        ApiException - if there is an error updating the ad rules
        java.rmi.RemoteException
